Detailed Description

Definitions for SPU-side Mailbox related functions and macros.

Note that most of the Mailbox functions initiated by SPU blocking.

Function Documentation

static void ctk_intr_mbox_write ( ctk_uint32_t  data  )  [inline, static]

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU outbound interrupt mailbox. [Blocking] SPU stalls if the mbox is full and count of the empty slots is 0.

Parameters:
[in] data - the value to be written.

static int ctk_intr_mbox_write_count (  )  [inline, static]

Gets the empty (available) slots of the SPU outbound interrupt mailbox.

Returns:
the number of available (32-bit) mailbox entries. A value 0 indicates the mbox is full and succeeding interrupt will block.

static void ctk_mbox_read ( ctk_uint32_t *  data  )  [inline, static]

Reads the contents of the SPU inbound mailbox. [Blocking] SPU stalls if the mbox has no unread entry.

Parameters:
[out] data - the value of the Mailbox.

static int ctk_mbox_read_count (  )  [inline, static]

Gets the unread entries of the SPU inbound mailbox.

Returns:
the number of nread (32-bit) mailbox entries. A value 0 indicates the mbox is empty and succeeding read will block.

static void ctk_mbox_write ( ctk_uint32_t  data  )  [inline, static]

Writes the 32-bit data specified by data into the SPU outbound mailbox. [Blocking] SPU stalls if the mbox is full and count of the empty slots is 0.

Parameters:
[in] data - the value to be written.

static int ctk_mbox_write_count (  )  [inline, static]

Gets the empty (available) slots of the SPU outbound mailbox.

Returns:
the number of available (32-bit) mailbox entries. A value 0 indicates the mbox is full and succeeding write will block.
